properties.title: The Midwest is our Home
properties.description: Here some highlights of the coolest places we've visited over the years.

properties.title: Red River Gorge
properties.description: This was one of the best trips I have ever been on. Complete with rain, snakes, Ale-8-One and so much amazing...nature!

properties.title: Assateague National Seashore
properties.description: One of the coolest memories from this trip was the scores of people fishing along the docks. If only I had gotten a pciture of the woman with the intricate sushi in her lunch box. This is where I lost that nice knife Pop's got for me that was the same one I got when I worked at Kimberton CSA.

properties.title: Delaware
properties.description: One of the most laid back campgrounds on the east coast. We used to come to the 'Jersey Shore' every summer as a kid and it's been so cool to keep those memories alive with you and keep that tradition going.

properties.title: Cooper's Rock
properties.description: This was one of my favorite places, though I had only been here once or twice. I was so excited to take you here. We have to go back sometime.

properties.title: Shawnee Backpack Trail
properties.description: You did not want to go on this three day hike as it was rainy, you were pregnant, and the 1970s backpack was not a comfotable fit. Stil, I do have some fond memories. Most memorable to me were the howling screech owls in the middle of the second night and the overlook on the final day.

properties.title: Five Year Anniversary to Clearwater
properties.description: This was such an amazing tripe. I could have done without getting stuck mangrove muck and the two hour walk in the rain, but having the beach to ourselves was awesome.

properties.title: Asheville, NC
properties.description: Would love to go back some time.
